Tom

Web Dev Projects

Web Dev Projects

Updated:

Hello, I'm Tom. Over the past two years, I have immersed myself in the world of web development, starting with building simple web apps using vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. As I delved deeper into the field, I became fascinated with React.js and soon began exploring the MERN stack.

Currently, my projects primarily leverage Next.js integrated with TypeScript, Prisma, and PostgreSQL for robust backends. (While I'm familiar with Prisma and PostgreSQL, I'm still in the process of deepening my understanding of these complex technologies.) For styling, I rely on Tailwind CSS, while media storage is handled by Cloudinary and Uploadcare. When it comes to unit testing, I rely on React Testing Library. My main projects, which you can find below, reflects my learning journey, with projects listed in descending order of their completion.


I'm particularly excited about the latest updates in React.js and Next.js, especially the introduction of server components. This breakthrough has revolutionized the way we approach frontend and backend divisions in web development. I eagerly await any future updates and advancements in these technologies.
